TopicTitle: "Surfex" - A medium-speed, land, sea and air explorer.

Articles.Content:
Surfex means Surface Explorer. It's equally at home on land, sea, and in the air; and it's tough enough to transition between them easily, even at speed. It's fast, agile and efficient, making it perfect for exploring the surface of Kerbin, and who knows where else... if you can get it there, of course.

Please try it out and let me know what you think. Although it's simple in design, it uses all the techniques I've learned through a great deal of trial and error, and I'm curious how it stacks up to others.

Thanks, and enjoy!

DOWNLOAD (scroll down to my section)

Edited November 30, 2015 by Ezriilc
Removed MechJeb and changed screenie.
Wow, that's pretty awesome. What speed can it reach in the water?

Wow, that's pretty awesome. What speed can it reach in the water?

Thanks!

I've had it up to 180 on the water in this config, I believe, but you don't want to try turning at those speeds.

This is one of the first craft I've developed that can take off and touch down to and from the water as well as on rough land. Having the entire oceans and most of the land as a giant landing strip makes exploration a breeze.
Very nice! I've been thinking about spaceplanes that can land/takeoff on water lately....

Very nice! I've been thinking about spaceplanes that can land/takeoff on water lately....

Thanks! Did you try it?

Incidentally, space is the only place it won't go.
